a.span: Log in to CLEVER from Home

p.span: I hope all of you are doing well and each of you are remaining healthy and safe. I can’t thank each of you enough for your patience and understanding as we navigate together through the COVID-19 pandemic.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #15 - April 13, 2020

p.span: I want to begin today’s update by sharing the empathy I have for our students and their inability to come to school each day to be with their friends, see their teachers, and experience different learning opportunities.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #14 - April 3, 2020

p.span: I hope that each of you are staying healthy and safe during this unprecedented time and the impact that COVID-19 is having on all of us. State health officials have made it clear that the safest place to be during this pandemic is at home.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #13 - April 1, 2020

p.span: This evening a letter from State Superintendent Tony Thurmond was sent to all County Superintendents and the information has been seen on the news and social media sites.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #12 - March 31, 2020

p.span: Paid sick leave and expanded family and medical leave under The Families First Coronavirus Response Act

a.title: Go to comments for Employee Rights

p.span:
Our Grab-N-Go lunch service-- will be changing the pick-up schedule. It will be as follows:
March 16-March 27 -- Monday through Friday 11 am to 1 pm
Pick-up lunch and next day’s breakfast at Charter Oak High School
March 30 through the end of the school closure
Pick up on MONDAY, WEDNESDAY, AND FRIDAY ONLY
11 am to 1 pm. Students will pick-up two meals

a.title: Go to comments for Food Services Schedule Change

p.span: I want to begin today’s update with a note of empathy. I realize that every time we turn on the news or read an announcement, it hasn’t been encouraging. All reports are stating that the pandemic has not flattened and it is critical to remain at home and practice social distancing.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #11 - March 23, 2020

p.span: First and foremost, I hope that all of you are safe and healthy. I completely understand that our current lifestyle has been altered. I am confident as a community, we will rally together and support each other educationally and personally during this unchartered time. I am proud of the assistance and encouragement being provided by our Charter Oak community, employees, and students.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #10 - March 20, 2020

p.span: If you were unable to pick up a copy of the Enrichment Packet on Wednesday, March 18, 2020, the packets will be available for pick up at Charter Oak High School on Thursday, March 19, 2020 from 11 am - 1 pm.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #9 - March 18, 2020

p.span: As with most of our surrounding districts, Charter Oak Unified School District (COUSD) is considering these next two weeks of the school closure as an opportunity to provide our students with enrichment opportunities through March 27, 2020. The enrichment packets will not be graded. If the school closures continue beyond March 27, 2020, more detailed information will be disseminated as to how the school district will be providing educational opportunities for all of our students. Please continue to monitor the COUSD website at www.cousd.net, the COUSD Twitter and Facebook pages and your email for further updates. Thank you.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #8 - March 18, 2020

p.span: As many of you may have heard, Governor Newsom held a press conference today at 5:00 pm. He stated that 98.8% of schools that have been closed are expected not to reopen before the summer break.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #7 - March 17, 2020

p.span:
We have been working diligently over the last 24-hours to make available the Enrichment Curriculum Packets for all Charter Oak Unified students.
At 8:00am on Wednesday, March 18 materials will be available online and hard copy.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #6 - March 17, 2020

p.span: As you can imagine the last few days have been a global whirlwind. Information about the COVID-19 virus changes by the hour. At Charter Oak Unified, we all want our students to have the opportunity to continue with an academic enrichment opportunity. Obviously, we want all of our students learning at our school sites where we offer full resources and have the best teachers working with your child. However, due to the restricted requirements placed upon us, we will need to adjust to the next best alternative.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #5 - March 16, 2020

a.aria-label: COVID-19 Parent Update #4 - March 15, 2020, Coronavirus Dismissal Reminder Image

img.alt: COVID-19 Parent Update #4 - March 15, 2020, Coronavirus Dismissal Reminder

a.span: COVID-19 Parent Update #4 - March 15, 2020, Coronavirus Dismissal Reminder

p.span:
This is a reminder that all Charter Oak Schools are dismissed from Monday, March 16 through Sunday, April 5. Any student who participates in the National School Lunch program can continue to receive their student meals by reporting to Charter Oak High School. Pick up will be in the drive through area of the student parking lot between the hours of 11:00am and 1:00pm. Please note that lunch will not be distributed over Spring Break.
In addition, Dismissal Enrichment Curriculum will be made available later in the week. Specific information regarding on-line access and/or pick-up of these materials will be provided via an email, phone call, and the website by Tuesday morning.
We will continue to provide all updates on our website at www.cousd.net and our social media accounts on Facebook and Twitter.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #4 - March 15, 2020, Coronavirus Dismissal Reminder

p.span: I appreciate your understanding and patience as we have all been dealing with a lot of uncertainty the last 24 hours. Late this morning, I received information from the Los Angeles County Office of Education (LACOE) that advised dismissal of schools throughout Los Angeles County. Therefore, Charter Oak Unified will be closed to students beginning Monday, March 16 through Sunday, April 5, 2020. This time period includes the recommended two weeks by LACOE and our regularly scheduled Spring Break. Effective Monday, this will include all school activities (including athletics), and before and after school care programs (including preschool).

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #3 - March 13, 2020

p.span: Per recommendation from the Los Angeles County Office of Education (LACOE) Superintendent, Dr. Debra Duardo, all districts in Los Angeles County will be dismissing all schools starting Monday, March 16. Charter Oak Unified will remain in dismissal through Spring Break (Sunday, April 5). More information will follow on how we will continue to provide instruction to students and other essential services.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #2 - March 13, 2020

p.span: Information continues to evolve and change on an hourly basis regarding the coronavirus. Charter Oak Unified is in discussion at the local and state levels to determine the impact and next steps for our district. We are aware of recent announcements by school districts in our area, and we will keep you updated as changes and decisions occur in our district.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #1 - March 13, 2020

p.span:
We continue to closely monitor information and developments regarding the coronavirus (COVID-19). The Charter Oak Unified School District is taking additional steps – out of an abundance of caution – to safeguard our students, staff, and campuses.
Wednesday evening, we received notification from LACOE that Los Angeles County moved to Scenario II. The reason for this designation is there have been two or more community (LA County is considered one community) transmission cases of COVID-19, however no individual within a school has tested positive. There are currently no known cases in the Charter Oak community.

a.title: Go to comments for COVID-19 Parent Update #0 - March 12, 2020

a.aria-label: Coronavirus Message to Parents March 3, 2020 Image

p.span: Recent national news coverage concerning the COVID-19 (Novel Coronavirus), has sparked conversations and questions from our community in regards to the health and safety of our students and staff, and we would like to share the following information with you.

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus Message to Parents March 3, 2020

p.span: The novel coronavirus is a new type of virus that recently started making people sick. It started in mainland China but is now also infecting people in other countries. Current knowledge is largely based on what is known about similar coronaviruses. As it is a new virus, we are learning more each day.

a.title: Go to comments for Novel Coronavirus Information
